setting.time: 64 AD, early afternoon, sun high and blazing
setting.location: Hillside grove outside Rome, ancient olive orchard
setting.weather: Scorching summer heat with shimmering air and no breeze

characters.appearance: Marcus Vinicius, young Roman patrician with intense dark eyes, and Lygia, blonde Lygian princess with gentle expression showing inner conflict
characters.clothing: Vinicius in light linen tunic showing his growing humility, Lygia in modest blue stola with Christian fish pendant visible
characters.position: Seated beneath ancient olive tree outside Rome, maintaining respectful distance
characters.action: Vinicius speaking of his growing love and understanding of Christianity, Lygia torn between affection and faith

scene.mainElements: Ancient olive trees with twisted trunks and silver-green leaves providing dappled shade, dry grass and scattered olives on ground
scene.details: Heat waves rising from sun-baked earth beyond shade, silver olive leaves rustling faintly in minimal breeze, ceramic water vessel sweating with condensation, leather sandals kicked off on dusty ground, fabric clinging to bodies from perspiration, cicadas droning in afternoon heat, patterns of light and shadow shifting on ground
scene.background: Rome visible in distance shimmering through heat haze, barren hills burnt golden brown, no movement in landscape except heat distortion
scene.atmosphere: Overwhelming heat intensifying emotional tension, blessed shade providing sanctuary for forbidden love, air thick with unspoken longing, drowsy warmth of growing passion, intimate refuge where pagan and Christian hearts meet

composition.cameraAngle: Medium shot from edge of shade looking toward figures
composition.focus: Two figures sheltering together under protective canopy of leaves
composition.depth: Foreground dappled shade patterns, middle ground resting figures against tree, background heat-hazed landscape and distant city
